topic.title: show
topic.shortdesc: Display deadlocks, logs, metrics and missing disk-stores.

topic.title: show dead-locks
topic.shortdesc: Display any deadlocks in the distributed system.

body.p: Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

row.entry: Name
Description
Required. Name of the file to which dependencies between members will be written.

p.codeblock:
gfsh>show dead-locks --file=deadlocks.txt No dead lock detected.
Please view the dependencies between the members in file : deadlocks.txt

topic.title: show log
topic.shortdesc: Display the log for a member.

body.p: Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

row.entry: Name
Description
Required. Name/ID of the member whose log file will be displayed.
Number of lines from the log file to display. The maximum is 100.

p.codeblock:
gfsh>show log --member=locator1 --lines=5 SystemLog: [info 2012/09/25 14:04:51.340 PDT locator1 <RMI TCP Connection(14)-192.168.129.1 29> tid=0x57] (tid=12 msgId=4) Parent region for "region1/subregion1" doesnt exi st.
[info 2012/09/25 14:04:51.372 PDT locator1 <RMI TCP Connection(14)-192.168.129.1 29> tid=0x57] (tid=12 msgId=5) Error occurred while executing "create region --n ame=region1/subregion1 --type=LOCAL".
[info 2012/09/25 15:14:34.314 PDT locator1 <RMI TCP Connection(159)-192.168.129. 129> tid=0x68] (tid=13 msgId=6) Error occurred while executing "show log --membe r=server1 --lines=5".

topic.title: show metrics
topic.shortdesc: Display or export metrics for the entire distributed system, a member or a region.

body.p: Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

row.entry: Name
Description
Name/ID of the member whose metrics will be displayed/exported.
Name/Path of the region whose metrics will be displayed/exported.
Name of the file to which metrics will be written.
Port number of the Cache Server whose metrics are to be displayed/exported. This can only be used along with the --member parameter.

Categories available based upon the parameters specified (listed above) are:
no parameters specified: cluster, cache, diskstore, query
region specified: cluster, region, partition, diskstore, callback, eviction
member specified: member, jvm, region, serialization, communication, function, transaction, diskstore, lock, eviction, distribution
member and region specified: region, partition, diskstore, callback, eviction

p.codeblock:
gfsh>show metrics
Cluster-wide Metrics
Type | Metric | Value --------- | --------------------- | ----- cluster | totalHeapSize | 123 cache | totalRegionEntryCount | 0 | totalRegionCount | 0 | totalMissCount | 0 | totalHitCount | 0 diskstore | totalBytesOnDisk | 0 | diskReadsRate | 0 | diskWritesRate | 0 | flushTimeAvgLatency | 0 | totalBackupInProgress | 0 query | queryRequestRate | 0

topic.title: show missing-disk-stores
topic.shortdesc: Display a summary of the disk stores that are currently missing from a distributed system.

body.p: Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

p.codeblock:
gfsh> show missing-disk-stores
Disk Store ID | Host | Directory ------------------------------------ | --------- | ------------------------------------- 60399215-532b-406f-b81f-9b5bd8d1b55a | excalibur | /usr/local/gemfire/deploy/disk_store1

topic.title: show subscription-queue-size
topic.shortdesc: Shows the number of events in the subscription queue.

body.p: If a CQ name is provided, it counts the number of events in the subscription queue for the specified CQ.
Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

row.entry: Name
Description
Required. The ID used to identify the durable client.
The name that identifies the CQ.
Name/Id of the member for which subscription queue events are to be counted.
Group of members for which subscription queue events are to be counted.

p.codeblock: gfsh>show subscription-queue-size --durable-client-Id=client1 member | subcription-queue-size for durable-client : "client1". ------- | ------------------------------------------------------ server3 | 1 server4 | 0

gfsh>show subscription-queue-size --durable-client-Id=client1
No client found with client-id : client1 Occurred on members 1.server4 2.server1 3.server3
